borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The scale, siting and design of the double storey side element would lead to the closure of a significant gap between the application site and neighbouring property No.96 Lichfield Road which is characteristic of the distinctive Becontree Esate. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:&nbsp;</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policy D4 and D8 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;<br></p><p>- Policies BP2, and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);&nbsp;</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and SPP6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020</p>

<p>The proposed double storey side extension, by reason of its sitting, would not maintain subservience to the main dwelling and would therefore harm the symmetry of the house in relation to its adjacent twin. The proposed development is therefore contrary to:</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policy D4 and D8 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies BP2, and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);&nbsp;</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and SPP6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020</p>
description: Construction of part two storey rear extension and side extension.
